item.description:
Body Talk is a charades game. A phrase to be guessed is drawn from one of over 700 difficulty rated cards. One player attempts to describe this phrase by pointing to icons on a board. The main twist here, and the reason the game is called Body Talk, is that both the game board with the icons and the pointer used are worn by the players. The gameboard is in the form of an icon-covered apron and the pointer is a bib with a pipe-cleaner protruding from it.

Small plastic clothespins indicate the scores or positions of the players and also indicate by color the difficulty rating of the phrase to be guessed.

Nuit Blanche is a simulation of the French national sport called Boule. Many active French players call it also Pétanque.
The aim of the game is to get your quite heavy metal balls as close to the smaller, wooden and colored 'jack'. The winner is the player whose ball is closest to the jack. The Team achieving first 13 points wins the match.

In this boardgame adaption you roll out the flexible map and soon opposing and own balls group themselves around the goal ball "jack" and the players stand before the decision, depending upon game situation, whether to aim or to shoot.

To determine if your action was successful or not you will use a two-pieced plastic ball with a pointer and two scales. In a dexterity depending action you shake that ball trying to get that pointer pointing at the right position. At first you won't succeed very well but with more experience you will find that this process is not only luck but also controllable.
Table top bowling game. Game comes with 10 wooden pins that measure approximately 4 1/2" tall & 3 wooden balls. The pins are vividly colored. Object of course is to knock down the most pins.

Object of this game is to reach a target sum exactly or to force an opponent over. Two dice are rolled and then 20 is added to that sum. That total becomes the target score. The game has a sheet with numbers on them. (1,2,3,4 repeated 4 times) Object is, on your turn to cover a number in an attempt to reach the Target score exactly. Players alternate covering numbers until either you cover a number that exactly hits the target score or you cover a number that forces your opponent go over the total because all he has left are number higher than what is needed. He then is forced to go over and you win.

This game was endorsed by the Adam Walsh Child Resource Center and is of course the product of the abduction and killing of Adam Walsh in 1981. His father John's successful television show "America's Most Wanted" has successfully caught criminals since. This game tries to teach children how to avoid and what to do when faced with danger.

name.value: Beetle Bailey's Hilarious New Army Game

item.description: Simple Spin and Move game from the Beetle Bailey Cartoon Strip. Featuring Beetle and the Sarge and Killer and Zero. Different spaces on the board either help or hinder your progress.

From the publisher's description:

"...you are ready to visit the wondrous House of Whack, the legendary extra dimensional mansion full of bizarre rooms, fiendish minions and outrageous artifacts.

The House looks different each time you play because the board unfolds as you open doors to reveal new rooms. Will you grab a snack from the Vending Machines or find yourself in the middle of the Minefield? Each room affects the way you play the game, presenting new strategies and dangers. And that’s not even taking into account the Whack Deck, which is full of entertaining wonders. Face the House’s wicked minions and traps, recruit allies to aid you, and discover violent and valuable props to add to the blender of mayhem that awaits you inside this game.

Whether you enjoy playing via cleverness, deceit, brute force, or cooperation, House of Whack has something to offer everyone!"

Home Page: http://www.houseofwhack.net

item.description:
From publisher's website:

If you're looking for a fun way to improve writing and grammar skills, this game is for you! For 2 to 6 players, grades 1st and up. Rules are easily mastered. The Sentence Zone can be played at six levels - from Level 1 in which the player builds a subject and verb sentence, to Level 6 in which the player builds complex sentences with independent and dependent clauses. With over 500 color coded cards, students are sure to be unique and entertaining every time. A great reinforcing individual activity where a player keeps track of his score from day to day, trying to top his previous score, or a great group activity where competition drives creativity and learning. An instructive and enjoyable way to shatter the tedium of English grammar lessons!

From the publisher's website:

Be the only player left with chips to win this fun and frantic dice game. Roll the dice to determine if you will "Put" or "Take" chips from the pot.

The yellow die can change everything as it lets you steal chips from your opponents. And, when you do, everything changes!

From the publisher's website:

Can you draw an egg? How about the sun? Then YOU can play Skribble Dash!™

Roll the die to choose the category. The harder the clue the more points you and the guesser will earn.

This crazy fun doodling game will keep EVERYONE on their toes as EVERYONE tries to guess what the player is drawing!

From the publisher's website:

So you think you're good, huh? Well, try this for size: you need to beat your opponent by getting rid of all your cards AND get the job done in 59 seconds! If either of you can't win before time runs out, you need to start the round over! The first one to win 5 rounds is the winner!

59 Seconds™ isn't called the world's fastest card game for nothing - you'll need skill, speed, and lightning fast reflexes to master this game!

Each player has its own robot production company. In order to build robots in time, players have to acquire, trade and build robot parts. Players sabotage each others production line which can lead to total destruction of an almost finished robot. Some construction parts are illegal and if the inspectors come to your factory they can confiscate your illegal parts.

Robotics is a crazy construction and trading game for 3-4 players in a not too distant future.

item.description:
In 1410 Polish king JagieÅ‚Å‚o fought the battle for supremacy over southern Baltic regions with Teutonic Knights order which called knights from all Europe for help. On 15th July over 30,000 of knights of both sides fought for supremacy and fame. The battle was complete victory of Polish forces and begun descend of power of Teutonic Order.

Game allows to fight on both side and use tremendous numbers of knight to repeat (or reverse) the result of the historical battle. Besides historical there is also scenario which allows to verify what would have happened if Teutonic Order didn't wait and attacked early on Polish army arriving on the battlefield.

Second edition of the game under new medieval system rules.

JDB Games' Vertical Gaming System are a series of 3D Tic-Tac-Toe games that help prepare students to understand and enjoy the fantastic Time Vectors.

3x3x3 Tic Tac Toe: Play until a student can always win if (s)he goes first.
4x4x4 Tic Tac Toe: Like Qubic, the first player can always win, but the solution isn't readily apparent.
5x5x5 Tic Tac Toe: An even further expansion, it's also possible to play for four-in-a row on this matrix.

Remember, these systems are stepping stones to Time Vectors--a wonderful, educational game for improving visual-spatial awareness.

The board represents a track that can be followed with a car (the pawns represent cars). Each player receivers his car and 250.000 francs at the start of the game. In each round the players roll the dice and advance their car. During the game the players can enter in sports events (they pass them on their track and they include a ski event, horseback riding, tennis, sailing or golf). These events cost 50.000 francs to enter but can earn the player points. The players can also encounter bad luck during their journey (flat tire, accident, they can even end up in hospital). In the end the player who completes the track first with the most points wins the game. This game was created in 1955 by the same designer as 1000 Bornes.

The goal of this windsurfing game is to surf faster a row of regatta's than your competitor on some of the most beautiful beaches around the world. The conditions to participate in certain regattas depends on the skills and the surfboards that a player has obtained. The surfboards can be obtained in auctions and they can be exchanged as well. He handles this part of the game the best has certainly got an advantage to win Surfer's Life.
The players try to make a path with cards that are marked with lines. The lines should connect to the goal of the opponents. The players can also try to interrupt the paths of their opponents.

Learn the term dividing whilst playing. Every player starts with a math task, the result determines which track has to be followed on the board. Three degrees of difficulty allow younger and older children to play this game.

A passionate game full of vital information. For adults and young people Ages 12 and up. How can we arm ourselves against AIDS ? Do mosquitoes transmit AIDS ? What is the immune system, the blind period ? Why is vaccine research so difficult ? You can find the answers to these and to many other questions in Tom & Lucy, the great educational game about AIDS. The objective : to be first to eliminate AIDS from 2 zones in the world.

The Felix Sex (Lucky Sixes) was a popular game played in the Roman Empire. Numerous boards, dices and pieces have been found and there are even some descriptions of the game in Latin documents. The Felix Sex appears to be the same as the Duodecima Scripta (The game of Twelve Points), probably the ancestor of the Backgammon and certainly very similar to the Ancient Greek board games.
The oldest boards have three rows of twelve playing squares, divided down the middle by a gap. Usually Romans had a fondness to divide the boards with letters instead of squares, with popular content and sometimes with rude comments.

From the back of the box:

"Eight different games to play!

Digging Up Dinosaurs - a quick-reflex matching game
Dinosaur Dup - you'll need good observation skills to win
Double Dinosaur - if you're lucky, you'll collect the most pairs
Dinosaur Snap - a race to win all the cards
Dinosaur Match-Up - a cooperative matching game
Dinosaur Rummy - the beginner's version
Advanced Dinosaur Rummy - Mom & Dad will like this one, too!
Fishin' for Dinos - everyone's favorite!

While enjoying many different games, dinosaur fans and their families can identify the 10 popular dinosaurs illustrated on the cards."

item.description:
From publisher's website:

Lexogon One is the same, addicting, word-finding game as Lexogon™, but designed especially for the vocabulary and spelling levels expected of middle-schoolers. As with Lexogon, everyone plays all the time. It’s great for intergenerational play, it’s an exciting game for family night play (or for occasions when players want an easier challenge than Lexogon). And teachers see Lexogon One as a great addition for their spelling and vocabulary sections. Kids give it a great learning testimonial. A typical comment from a fourth grader – “I can’t believe I’m learning something and having fun at the same time."
Colored magnets are placed on the drawing board. Hints are given, where to draw lines. The children then have to guess the image.
Jump contest at the frog lake! Can you jump far enough to reach the lake? But you only get points if you can place three frogs in a row.

item.description:
Roll the colored dice and move the little mouse over the board. Colored cars give you things to do: imitate animals, dance in a circle, make funny faces. For doing that, you get a new piece to build a tent for the mouse. Everybody plays together.

The game is for the very young (20 months up) and develops social skills, rhythm, language, motor function and playing with rules.

item.description: Swedish game based on real medieval personalities. You go to a tournament and have to get a horse, armor, weapon and a squire. When you have that you can compete in four different tournament disciplines. When one player is the champion in all disciplines he wins the game.

A house with 12 flats. Each flat contains a stack of images. The top image shows who lives here. Then the doors are closed. The dice decides where you can ring. But you can only open the door, after guessing who is living there. If you are right you get the image card.

Nicely made memo game.
The players look at several images (holiday pictures) and try to find out who has the most cars, animals, trees, etc. in their pictures.

This Bingo variant incorporates elements of the card game Whist. At the start of the game, a standard playing card deck is dealt out evenly into stacks in front of all of the players. Each player is given a board showing all of the values in all of the suits. Every turn, starting with the dealer, players ante into the pot and turn up the top cards of their stacks. The player with the highest-ranked card wins the trick and gets to put a chip on their board in the corresponding space. Losers all have to put chips into the pot. The first player to get five consecutive values in a single suit (a vertical row) or four suits in a single value (a horizontal row) calls Whist-O and wins the pot.

The game includes 12 boards and a bag of red plastic chips, but playing cards are not provided.

extrapolated From Games Archives rules for the game; HI-RO is a fast and exciting game. Any number of players may play by having a tray of blocks (dice). The object of the game is to turn your blocks until all 5 of them have the same number appearing along the row of sides facing you. The first person to accomplish this calls out "Hi RO" and receives a score determined by the size of the numbers that he/she lines up.

The 5 blocks are set up to that all blanks appear at the top then the tray is passed around the table. The first player moves the center block 3 spaces. That in turn will reveal a number on the top block. That number determines the number of spaces that the next player must turn and so on. Each player must turn the center block with his first play. After that he may move any of his blocks in an attempt to line up 5 faces numbered alike. The top side of each block last turned controls the move of the next player but you try to score the sides facing you.

name.value: Battle of the Sexes Card Game: IQ Test

item.description:
Forget about measuring your IQ with a traditional test - get your brain working overtime with the Battle IQ Test that requires superior gender and mind-bending abilities!

The winner is the first team to win 3 cards.
50 cards with 144 Questions

name.value: Battle of the Sexes Card Game: Blind Date

item.description:
Battle of the Sexes Blind Date is about defending your gender and finding out once and for all which sex really knows more about the dating game - Male or Female?

This card game tests one's knowledge of the opposite sex with a series of gender-based questions or challenges on dating, love, friendship and relationships.

From the rules: "Chevauchee (translated: 'War Ride') is a simple card-based medieval battle game for 2 players. Players draw cards from several decks to form a Base Force made up of Household units, Commanders, Tactics Cards, Mercenaries, Levies, and Weapons and Equipment. Players can then allocate funds from the war chest to get additional Mercenaries, Levy, or Weapons and Equipment to customize their armies further. Players then proceed to deploy for two combats, the Van, which is an abbreviated engagement, and the Main, which is the heart of the game. Victory goes to the side that sweeps the battlefield of all opposing units by the end of any Main Combat Round (not Van)."

name.value: Barney Google and Spark Plug Game

item.description: Spin and move game where Barney is trying to get Sparkplug (his horse) to his Reward of a bail of hay without Sparky winding up in the Glue Factory.
From Kidd's: Card Game based on the Gene Byrnes Famous Cartoon from the mid 1920's. Also known as the "Peppy Game"

Advertised as a 'Family fun Game" for Ages 3 and up.

Game box advertises that the game comes with a super speed roller puck, carom boards and a slick durable playing board.

Hockey for two. Hit the puck into the other person's goal. A blocker is located in front of each goal to act as a helper "goalie".

name.value: La Chenille qui fait des trous: Le Jeu
Die kleine Raupe Nimmersatt: Das Spiel

item.description:
Players spin the spinner and move their caterpillar box around the board, adding food pieces to their box. At various points, players must collect enough food to proceed. First player around the board wins.

This is a different game from the same-named Very Hungry Caterpillar Game, which is made further confusing because both games have very similar box-fronts, using the same picture from the cover of the book. This game requires players to move around a board and collect food, meeting certain goals along the way.

item.description:
Description from designer's website:

There's a vampire hiding in the cemetery, and the town council has offered a large reward to the first grave digger who can find the creature and destroy it. The tools you'll need are scattered around the cemetery grounds, but the vampire has summoned several phantoms to break those tools before you can use them. You also might dig up the wrong grave and miss your chance to destroy the vampire. But such is the life of a grave digger...

Object Of The Game:

Try to destroy the vampire by digging up the right grave. You must have three tools (a pick, a shovel and a stake) to dig up and kill the vampire. The phantoms will try to break your tools.

Athens & Sparta is a strategic level block game of the Peloponnesian War, fought from 431BC to 404BC. This war pitted the superior wealth and naval power of Athens against the militarism of Sparta. It was a bloody contest, with many heroic triumphs and great atrocities. Victory by Sparta ended the Golden Age of Greece.

This game provides insight into why the war was fought the way it was. One player controls the wealthy and sea faring Athenians, the other the powerful armies of the Spartans. The object is to control important city-states that dotted the Grecian landscape.

In order to create a fog of war, unit blocks are stood up with the backs facing the opponent. In this manner the opponent cannot tell the type or the strength of the units being deployed against him until battle begins. Along the sides of the unit blocks, only visible to the owner until it comes time for combat, are numbers that represent the strength of the unit. The current strength is on top. As the unit takes losses, it is rotated so a lesser value is on top.

From the Game:

Captain your own narrowboat around the canal system. There are locks to negotiate, a tunnel to go through, an aqueduct to cross, as well as hazard squares and detour points to avoid. Breakdown vans are called to repair your boat in the event of mishap. Climb aboard and select your one or two week narrowboating holiday and Good Luck!

This family boating game is for children of all ages, and recommended playing Ages 7 and up.

item.description:
Truchet is an abstract strategy game for two players based on a novel tiling of the plane with single type of two sided tile, which results in a variable pattern of rivers and islands which constitute the board. During play, tiles can be flipped which reconfigures the 
connectivity of dark and light areas of the board. The standard board size is 7x7.

Each player starts with 12 stackable markers, which can either move along a river, join to form new stacks, or split stacks into multiple smaller pieces. Capturing is by direct replacement. The goal of the game is to capture all of the opponents pieces.

Online Play

 Boardspace.net (real-time, AI option)
 Gamerz.net (PBEM)

Glückshaus is a simple 15th-16th century dicing game popular among mercenaries then and historical re-enactors now. A board shows the numbers from 2-12, excepting 4. Players take turns throwing two dice.

On a 3,5,6,8,9,10,or 11, if the corresponding space holds a coin, they take it; if the space is empty, they place a coin. On a 7 ("the Wedding"), a coin is always placed on the board, forming a growing jackpot. A 2 ("the Pig") takes all the coins except the pile on 7; A 12 takes all the coins on the board. On a 4, nothing happens, or the player may have paid the house, as no 4-space appears on surviving boards.

name.value: Discovery Channel QUEST the adventure game

item.description:
From the "Code of Conduct" sheet:
You are a Traveler, on the path to discovery. Throughout your journey you will be asked to face the challenges, adventures and consequences of the choices that you make. On your journey you will be searching for various Treasures. once all the Treasures have been collected, the Traveler with the most Treasures wins.

Contents:

 Large game box with one large board 19" X 37"
 8 pawns
 Timer
 Dice
 Pads of paper
 480 cards.

Simple Indoor ring toss game featuring Beany and Cecil the sea sick sea serpent cartoon characters.

The game has pictures of Captain Horatio Huffenpuff, Beany's kindly uncle and the Captain of the Leakin' Lena which takes the pals from one destination to the other. The Captain is always willing to instruct Beany and Cecil on their latest assignment, but refuses to put himself in any personal jeopardy, locking himself in the belowdecks for most of the episodes.
 Crowy, the navigator of the Leakin' Lena. He is a crow, and unsurprisingly spends most of his time in the crow's nest. He speaks in a squawky voice and has a tendency to faint dead away whenever the ship encounters some sort of hazard.

Dishonest John, the villain of the piece. He is dressed like a Simon Legree character, and he is constantly scheming to foil Beany and Cecil's adventures. His catchphrase is a sinister "Nya ha ha!". Information Extrapolated from From the wikipedia free encyclopedia;

name.value: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

item.description:
The lead product of Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition. This is the fourth edition in the Star Fleet Battles series, and it is the current edition.

There have been two major reprintings of the rules, each of which incorporates some errata and cleanup in the rules in 1999 and 2005. These can be identified by a year printed on the lower part of the front cover.

Re-implements:

 Star Fleet Battles
 Star Fleet Battles Designer's Edition
 Star Fleet Battles Commander's Edition

item.description:
This book, released in 1976, includes rules for more than 80 non-traditional games, many of the cooperative ilk. It is an outgrowth of a yearly New Games festival which took place for awhile in the early 1970s.

While the book looks quite dated (seeing the cover, font, and artwork brings to mind the word "peacenik"), it is still quite useful for impromptu games with any number of participants. The book is divided into three segments: games for two, games for a dozen, and games for two dozen (or more).

Interspersed within the game descriptions are some interesting articles about the "New Games Movement." A follow-up book, "More New Games", was released in 1981 and the current director of New Games released "Best New Games" in 2002.

From the rules book:

Grandgammon is a game combining both skill and luck for two to six players. When the game is played by two people it is identical to the game known as backgammon.

Grandgammon is an extension of backgammon permitting the game to be played by more than two players.

Online Play


 Gamerz (turn-based, play by email or play by web)

Rapid Fire! is a two-player shooting-gallery game in which the object is to knock down targets of the other player's color.

The targets - alternating in red and yellow - rotate on a circular, battery-powered central wheel. Rotating in the opposite direction are blocking pegs, which protect the targets. For younger players, the blocking pegs may be removed.

Players fire marble-like balls (also colored red and yellow to represent the owning player) up slightly inclined ramps from opposite sides of the target gallery, with play continuing until one player has eliminated all of the targets in the opposing player's color.

The whole set-up measures over three feet long when assembled. Unlike many shooting gallery games, the trick here is in the timing of the shots - finding moments when an opponent's target will rotate into view and blocking pegs rotate away - rather than in the aim.

How well do you know your US Geography?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the state in question and various visual clues. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

These miniatures rules for the Ancient and Medieval periods were first published in 1978 as "War Cry and Battle Lust." The Second edition in 1981 (now called simply "War Cry") featured poster-sized wall charts printed with the combat tables and terrain effects charts.

Second edition War Cry seems to have been the only product ever published in the Judges Guild's "Emperor Series."

TrigO™ is a creative board game that teaches the rudimentary concepts of trigonometry. The game has six levels of play ranging from beginner to advanced.

Each player receives 6 playing pieces of the same color, one for each of the trigonometric functions. There can be 2 to 6 players.
Players will learn the names of the six major trigonometric functions: SIN, COS, TAN, COT, SEC, CSC. Advanced rules provide you with concepts of the four quadrants and the signs for each function in each quadrant.
Players will learn the ratios of the sides of a right triangle for the six major trigonometric functions. The triangular playing pieces are specially designed to show the direction of rotation for your playing piece around each triangular path.

The simple rules for the novice is called the "Beginners Game" In this game you will learn the names of the six functions and what constitutes a triangle.
In the "Direction Game" a player will find that there is a clockwise and counterclockwise direction of movement.
The "Function Game" requires you to start your playing piece such that it moves onto the numerator for the trigonometric ratio of your playing piece and then onto the denomator for that playing piece.
In the "Many Triangles Game" a player will make use of smaller right triangles to shorten the distance of travel.
In the "Quadrant Game" the player will find that there are four quadrants on the playing board with a specific sign for each trigonometric function as represented by the playing pieces.
In the "Function Sign Game" the player will need to observe the sign for each playing piece for the quadrant it is in.

Another tactical game from Swiss publisher Arte Ludens.
The goal of this abstract game with wooden tiles is to reach the opposite side with your own tiles. But on your way there your tiles may be blocked. You can defend yourself by blocking opposite tiles. You just put yours onto them but avoid running out of tiles.

Each of the 2-7 players tries to put the own tiles next or upon tiles already lying on the table. The tile must be of suitable color/form combination, because not every tile fits in the three-dimensional building concept. Only the player who places his tiles smartly has a chance to win.

Kuado is a highly tactical but quick game in which each of the 2 players tries to put a square of 4 sticks on a foundation of 4 stones. The opposing building of squares can be prevented by blocking with own sticks.

Three Crowns is a sophisticated game of pattern-formation, which was designed by Larry Back in 2000 for the 2001 8x8 Game Design Competition co-sponsored by About Board Games, Abstract Games magazine and the Strategy Gaming Society. Every game is a sharp battle. The goal is to crown your pieces, then to build a "crowned troika", a formation of three or more crowned pieces in a straight line, orthogonally or diagonally, all belonging to the same player.

Tropical Tycoon is a modified version of Monopoly that incorporates new rules, new pieces, and new winning conditions. It uses a DVD (required) to generate random events.

New additions include:

Players have Jobs that give individual advantages.

In addition to beach houses (houses) and resorts (hotels), properties can be developed with Casinos, Parks, Restaurants, and Piers. The rent for the Casino is pure luck, but sometimes the owner has to pay out to the visitor. Parks don't garner much rent, and what rent they gather is based on the weather, which can change with every Chance or Community Chest event (the Park's main benefit is its worth in Fortune Tokens at game end: A Park on Gentle Sands is the equivalent of four million dollars cash at the end of the game). Piers' rent depends not only on the weather, but also the presence or absence of a cruise ship, which is also affected by the card events. Finally, Restaurants' rent is dependent upon the neighboring property improvements. There are very few of these developments, though, so the competition for them can be fierce!

Although the basic board layout is the same as a standard Monopoly board, there are no Chance and Community Chest cards; when a player lands on one of those two spots, the DVD determines what happens.

One of the dice has a TV symbol in place of the 1-pip; when the TV is rolled, a News Broadcast is played on the DVD, which triggers a random event (much like Chance or Community Chest).

Players collect Fortune Tokens (and earn them at the end of the game through their cash and property holdings). Play ends when one player goes bankrupt (or, alternately, whenever the players decide to stop). The player with the most Fortune Tokens at the end of the game wins.

item.description:
Eat Electric Death! is the exciting board game of tactical starship combat set in the wild and wacky Weird Worlds universe (made famous in the award-winning computer game Weird Worlds: Return to Infinite Space) for two carbon-based life forms.

Players will command an array of starships from such intergalactic species as the calculating mechanical Tan Ru, the bloodthirsty savage reptilian Garthans, and the noble Zorg, masters of time and space. Annihilation is only a chit pull away as energy weapons, missiles, and even old fashioned projectiles hurdle across the map while ships maneuver for the optimum firing spot. When found shields collapse, bulkheads shatter, and sometimes even a reactor blows. For some, crews will work to repair the damage, while for others salvation is only possible through victory.

Eat Electric Death! plays like a rocket to the stars – fast – with easily understood rules that will have you battling within minutes of opening the box and punching counters. Varied scenario types provide plenty of adventure, and the game lends itself well for telling your own tales. Intuitive playing aids create a minimum of bookkeeping chores while allowing plenty of sci-fi chrome. Starship combat this sleek is rarely seen on your kitchen table.

If you like your aliens ugly, your starships shiny, and your ship on ship action frenzied and fun, then look no further than Eat Electric Death!, your space opera in a box!

Kill the monster, grab the treasure, stab your buddy. That's what it's all about. Now, Munchkin has been transformed into a board game...

In Munchkin Quest, you can co-operate with the whole group, adventure with a partner, or strike out on your own. You don't know what's behind a door until you open it...then another tile is added to the dungeon. Battle monsters for power and treasure, or send them after your friends. Reach Level 10, then get out alive if you can!

name.value: The Little Prince Protects his Planet
Der kleine Prinz beschützt seinen Planeten
Le Petit Prince protège sa planète

item.description:
Players help the Little Prince protect his planet from Baobab Tree saplings, which, if they grow into full trees, will destroy the Little Prince's planetoid.


Die Spieler helfen dem Kleinen Prinzen, seinen Planeten vor Sprösslingen von Affenbrotbäumen, die so groß werden, dass sie den Planeten zerstören können, zu beschützen.

name.value: Der kleine Prinz geht auf die Reise
The Little Prince Goes on a Trip
Le Petit Prince part en voyage

item.description:
With a flock of wild birds, the Little Prince travels from planet to planet. The players help the Little Prince to visit all of the planets in the right order.

Aim of the game (from Rule book):
To help the little prince go travelling and discover as many planets as possible. Beware, each planet must be associated with a flock of birds. In Fact, the prince can only travel if a flock of birds comes to collect him.

On his turn a player turns over an objective card and has 3 attempts to slide stars tiles on the board to discover the planet shown on the objective card and a flock of birds.
If he doesn't manage to do it, next player has three goes.
Fist player to find the good planet and a flock of birds wins the tile. Than next player turn a new objective card.
Once the 8 objective cards have been given, player with the most cards win.

Note:
In the same collection from the publisher Petit Jour, there are two other games with the little prince anthem:
the little Prince protects is planet and the little prince tames the fox.


Mit einem Schwarm wilder Vögel reist der kleine Prinz von Planet zu Planet. Die Spieler sind dem kleinen Prinzen behilflich, alle Planeten in der richtigen Reihenfolge zu besuchen.

The game is actually two distinct games, each of which consists of two books. Any book can be used by itself for a (short) solo game. The books can be paired (White Warlord against Black Baron, or Emerald Enchanter against Scarlet Sorcerer) to play a two-player duel.

“I’ll trade you a cabbage and some duct tape for your toddler.”
A game about trading and building for 3 to 5 players.
Learn what ingredients you need to make things. Turn money into ingredients. Turn ingredients into things. Use your things to give you an advantage over your opponents. Learn what things you need to build doodads. Build doodads out of things. Use your doodads to give you an even greater advantage over your opponents. End the game with the most diverse collection of doodads, things, and ingredients.

The game is freely downloadable on the publisher's site:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/443/Doodads

Halfanutz is a card game about elephants. Tom Wham's younger sisters couldn't say the word elephant when they were toddlers so they said "halfanutz" instead.

The basic game consists of walkabout and scoring phases. In the walkabout phase the player draws a card. Then they can either push their luck and draw another card or they can take the cards they already have behind their screen and pass the turn to somebody else. If they draw a card with the same picture as a card they already have, they lose the cards they've drawn and their turn. After all the cards have been drawn, the scoring phase happens. Players sort their cards by the resource pictured on it, then count the largest pile of cards and subtract the smallest pile of cards. After two sessions the scores are totaled and a winner declared.

The advanced game adds resources and a trick taking phase (called "the rumble"). During the walkabout for each card turned over, the player also gets a resource of the type on the card. The player gets to keep the resource, even if the cards end up being discarded. During the trick taking phase, the players randomly play a card from the cards they have collected. The cards are numbered and the highest number wins. The twist is that your card can be reinforced by resources of the same type as the card played. The players take turns reinforcing their cards or passing. The player with the highest card number + resources played wins the trick. Players then score the number of cards they have taken during the rumble. Again, two sessions are played and the scores are totaled.

The tournament game is like the advanced game, except the card played during the rumble is not chosen randomly.

Halfanutz is self-published by Tom Wham and is available from his web site, http://www.tomwham.com.

name.value: Ken il Guerriero: Gioco di Carte Collezionabili

item.description:
Produced by Alchemia in 1994, the Hokuto No Ken collectible card game has been available only in Italy. The card game contains almost every character found in the original anime series and the cards are illustrated with stills taken from the TV show itself.

It is a one vs one game, each player uses his own deck, just like in Magic The Gathering and most of the others CCGs around. The game is now out of print.

Apart from the base set of 200 cards, the following expansion sets have been released:

Il re del mondo (1994)

Le Cinque Forze (1995)

Le Tecniche (1996)

I Demoni (1997)

La Nuova Era (1998)

Le Nuove Cinque Forze (2000)

Sotto il Segno dell'Orsa (special cards given in various conventions)

The Salt Birds of Akarah has elements of both a pickup-and-deliver game and a combat game. Players control a number of birds, each trying to pick up salt crystals, and bring them back to their home base. Along the way, you can freeze and opponent's birds with arctic crystals, zap them with laser beams, and contend with them in an "exciting fruit challenge." The latter uses a guessing game mechanic, where the object is to successfully discard disks that are marked with bad habits, such as "greedy," "obnoxious," "reckless," and "untrustworthy."

The Salt Birds of Akarah has been awarded US Patent number 4927155.

The inventive game may be played by from two to four players, each one of which has a home base game piece and a plurality of salt birds. At the beginning of the game, the home bases and a plurality of other game pieces are placed on the game board in a prescribed manner including a plurality of salt tablets. Each player has a plurality of bird game pieces for movement on the board. Each player has a plurality of discs describing various bad habits. The object of the game for each player is to obtain a predetermined number of salt tablets by moving their bird game pieces and landing on the spaces having salt tablets, then returning the obtained salt tablets to their home bases while getting rid of their bad habit discs.
From the rules: "Gridfun is a football game, employing three dials with spinners, one for kicking, one for running and one for forward passing."

Leaping Lemmings - The Original Cliff Divers

Leaping Lemmings is a humorous game for 2-6 players. Each player controls a cloned clan of lemmings that have been specially trained to compete with the other lemming clans, all trying to scurry down a canyon and hurl themselves over a cliff. Distance and style points are important. One lemming diving with style and élan is worth as many as five of the more mundane divers. But beware the hungry eagles circling overhead or your lemmings might not even make the cliff edge!

Objective: The player with the most victory points wins the game. To earn victory points, players dive their lemmings over the cliff edge and/or collect Lemming Chow Pellets.

The game board is a hex-based map representing the canyon down which up to six separate lemming clans will travel. The canyon ends with the cliff edge hexes, which are the lemmings' ultimate goal. Between the lemmings and their goal there are two eagles circling overhead hoping for multiple lemming snacks.

Each turn a movement card is revealed which will allow for 2-5 lemming movement points. Card luck is mitigated in that all players use the same card to move that turn. Only the top lemming in each stack is allowed to move, so covering your opponents' lemmings is one tactic that is used to slow them down. The down side is that the top lemming in each stack is the only one in danger of becoming eagle chow.

Special Actions allow players to briefly alter the normal rules of the game to their advantage or to their opponents' detriment. There are 16 different Special Actions in the game.

Home Page: http://www.gmtgames.com/p-143-leaping-lemmings.aspx

item.description:
Vanguard: Men At Arms is a set of miniatures wargame rules aimed at gaming small scale skirmish actions between the 12th and 15th Century.

Players can control a dozen or more soldiers in fast and bloody clashes with their opponent as they try to raid, ravage and wreak havoc in enemy territory.

Each figure on the table represents 2-5 men, with a ground scale of 5 yards to the inch. Therefore a game between two forces of twenty men on a 6' x 4' table will represent about 70 soldiers per side fighting across an area about a quarter of a mile across.

At the climax of the American Civil War the armies of the Confederacy were pressed back into their heartland as the rebellion tried desperately to sustain itself against Union forces. One of the most important campaigns occurred in southeastern Tennessee and Georgia, as Federal armies pressed toward the Confederacy’s vital city of Atlanta, home to much of its remaining industry and gateway to the southern and western lands the Confederates still held. The campaign for and siege of this vital city broke the power of the Army of Tennessee, the key rebel command outside northern Virginia.

The theater of these operations is roughly bounded by the Tennessee River to the north, the Chattanooga area to the west, Atlanta to the south, and the Appalachian Mountains to the east. It was here where the formidable Union command team of Sherman and Thomas plied their trade, dooming the Confederacy's last chance to survive the Yankee onslaught. Here too the soldiers of the rebel Army of Tennessee fought stubbornly to defend their homes.

Look Away! The Fall of Atlanta is a strategic-operational simulation of the Army of Tennessee's campaigns in the Georgia theater of the Civil War. The game covers the fighting between Union and Confederate forces in Tennessee and northern Georgia during the spring and summer of 1864. Each hexagon represents an area roughly 2.6 miles in diameter (4 km). Each turn in the game represents about four days of real time. There are four scenarios dealing with the major engagements of the war plus a campaign game covering the entire period.

Look Away is the third game in John Prados' series on the American Civil War, following The Campaigns of Robert E. Lee and The Army of the Heartland: The Army of Tennessee's Campaigns, 1861-1863.

link.value: John Prados American Civil War Campaigns

item.description:
Museum Pictoris is the board game in which players become great collectors of painting masterpieces.

The players will be able to compete collecting, buying and selling the best paintings of the History of Art.

Museum Pictoris is recommended for any age, from 8 years and up. Museum Pictoris is the best way to go deeply into the fascinating world of the History of Art. It is not necessary to have any knowledge about art to play and win, but after a few games and without any effort at all, one will become an art expert.

Museum Pictoris includes 144 high quality reproductions of painting masterpieces, selected among 50 museums worldwide, of 89 great artists from the XIV century Gothic Style to the XIX century Romantic Style.

Museum Pictoris is much more than just a game; it is a fascinating trip through the History of Art.

Home Page: http://www.museum-pictoris.com

Die kleine Hexe is a game based on the childs book by Otfried Preußler (published in English as: The little Witch). The players move the little witch and her raven Abraxas around to help them do her good works. If they succeed within a set number of rounds, all players win (the player who helped most wins a little bit more). Otherwise, all players lose.

The playing field consists of the inside of the box, which is filled with a number of steeples with loose tops. Above them, held by wooden sticks in the corner of the box, is the (cardboard) sky. The little witch moves on her broom among the churches, held and led by a magnet above the sky.

There are 13 cards (hidden after the games starts) showing the good tasks, each with a colored chip corresponding to a location in the 'city'. In each player turn a task gets selected. The player now has to remember the correct card and fly the little witch between the high church towers to the correct location, without accidentally knocking down one of the tipsy tops.

item.description:
From the back of the box: ``Quick, quick! ... In order to win you must gather all your items before the wolf has all its clothes on. The players take turn drawing from the bag, but be careful, if the wolf's head appears, you have to put an item of clothing on him! This fun game is suitable for players of 3 years and over because there are three versions of the game: all together, one against another or alone... But always against the Wolf.

The game comes with a board representing a forest, onto which six different kinds of items are spread: mushrooms, strawberries, snails, blackberries, flowers and butterflies. In addition, each player receives one leaf-shaped individual board that is uniformly green on one side (for using in cooperative mode), and covered with the shapes of five of the six items on the other side (used in competitive and individual modes). The wolf is drawn on a magnetic board and its five items of clothing (shoes, trousers, jacket, hat and umbrella) are magnetic too. In the bag, eight cardboard discs represent each of the six items that can be picked from the forest, plus the head of the wolf and a clover leaf.

The players draw in turn one disc from the bag. If the wolf's head is drawn, they put an item of clothing onto the wolf. If it is the clover leaf, they can take one item of clothing off the wolf or choose one item of their choice from the forest (competitive and individual mode) or two items from the forest (cooperative mode). Otherwise, they take the item represented on the disc from the forest. The disc is then put back in the bag and passed to the next player.

In competitive mode, the winner is the first player who manages to pick up all the items represented on his board. In cooperative mode, the players win if they manage to empty the forest before the wolf is fully clothed. In individual mode, the player wins if he manages to pick up all the items represented on his board. The game is lost in any mode if the wolf gets all its clothes on.

name.value: Lilla Anna och Långa Farbrorns Tårtspel

item.description:
Roll the die and move. If you end at a blue square take a blue card. If you end at a red square, take a red one and make an imitation of the animal shown. Then take a blue card.

When you have two identical blue cards you may trade them against a "cake card". The first player with four "cake cards" is the winner.

Game consists of cards and "speedometer" dials for players to keep score. On one's turn, one draws a card and moves one's speedometer pointer the number of mph indicated. If one goes over 65 mph, a penalty of reducing one's speed is incurred.

The first player to land exactly on 65 mph wins.

item.description:
Print and play micro wargame. From the ad copy on RPG Now:

Pirates & Treasure & Zombies, Oh My!

When pirates defile graves just for some easy gold, you know there will be trouble, especially when it's a witch's treasure buried in a graveyard for the most notorious of sea dogs.

Easy gold it won't be with other pirates after it and the dead raising to take you to their side. Will you become rich and retire to a life of leisure or will the grave you are digging up become your own?

Dead Man's Island is a strategy adventure for 1 to 4 players Ages 10 and up

item.description:
From Publishers Website:

Using three pack of Memo-Rico cards, players can engage in up to four captivating and educational games, designed to help youngsters know their multiplications like the backs of their hands! In groups or alone, learning has never been so fun and easy!

Suggested Ages & Up

Epyx VCR Golf features 18 different holes from the world's most famed golf courses. Pinehurst, Jupiter Hills, Miami's Doral Country Club and other equally spectacular courses. Epyx VCR Golf tests the very soul of classic golf strategy.

Play against yourself, against an opponent or three opponents. You move the ball from tee to green deciding each shot along the way. There are three ways a player can make a stroke: You can select a club card which includes a predetermined shot distance. You can roll the dice once you hit the green. Or you can play the videocassette featuring real live action footage, courtesy of ABC Sports and the PGA of America. And all the pros are there.

But, of course, the hottest pro on the tour is somebody you're very familiar with, You. You're the one who decides everything. Beginning to feel the pressure?

name.value: Shaun of the Dead Card Game

item.description:
This is a fast paced 'print and play' card game based around the hit UK film Shaun of the Dead. You must help your group to survive against an onslaught of zombie attacks by using innovative weapons such as cricket bats, spades, darts and even a Dire Straits record!

To get this game for free, go to the address below;

http://mmboardgames.page.tl/

Shaun of the Dead is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorised, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.

This is a fast paced 'print and play' card game based around the hit classic TV show Bewitched. Samantha the witch married mortal Darrin much to the dismay of her family. You must try to make their marriage succeed and stop Samantha’s family from interfering and transforming Darrin in to all manner of things including a chimp, a little boy and even a fish!

Bewitched is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.

The usual Uno (including themed editions without new cards) rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

Based on the Disney Channel Movie High School Musical.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Duet Card' There are 4 pairs of characters in th "High School Musical." When you play the Duet card, all other players must discard one of the pairs from their hand (2 cards). If a player cannot discard a pair, they must draw 2 cards from the DRAW pile and add those cards to their hand.

WrestleFest is a table-top dice rolling game with mini's, based on wrestling. It has over 150 wrestlers, managers, and officials, and 9 match types. Match types include, Cage, Barbed Wire, and Ladder. WrestleFest also includes 8 different ring types.

'WrestleFest's minis, rings, and more are all print-and-play! Download from the WrestleFest website.

Home Page: http://www.wrestlefestonline.com/

Shichi Narabe is a card game closely related to Fan Tan (another card game not to be confused with the gambling game known by the same name); both games are frequently known as "Sevens", adding to the confusion.

In Shichi Narabe, a traditional card deck is dealt out; players place all 7s onto the table. From there, players may play cards higher than the highest card currently on the table, or lower than the lowest card. (Aces are low). The game is described at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shichi_narabe.

The primary difference from Fan Tan (the card game) is that in Fan Tan, the 7s are not played to the table to start the game.

name.value: Curious George Adventures: Joins the Circus
Curious George Adventures. Curious George Joins the Circus

item.description:
2 distinct games in each box. The first is for 2 -4 players Ages 4 and up. That game has its own board and is basically a go around the path trying to join the circus first by matching colors.

The second game with its own board on the reverse side is also for 2-4 players Ages 7 and up and requires that the players go around the Big Top following simple directions in order to get extra turns, or special moves along the way.

Game includes one two-sided game board, one yellow hat, 4 tally cards, 4 pawns 30 tokens and 40 cards.

name.value: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: The Doomsday Device

item.description: The eighth game in the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks pits Marvel Comics' Fantastic Four against Dr. Doom.

A Samuri vs. Samurai battle in the setting of AD&D Oriental Adventures. One player plays Prince Matabei, the rebel commander. The other player plays Lord Kenshin, the Daimyo of Tsuke.

Part of the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks.

name.value: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: Dragonsword of Lankhmar

item.description:
Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser vs. The Thieves' Guild Assassins. The heroes attempt to complete a quest while the guild sends wave after wave of villains to stop them.

Part of the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks.

name.value: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: Revenge of the Red Dragon

item.description:
A game of knight vs. dragon.

The knight, Raven Quickblade, must recover stolen treasure from the dragon and escape. The dragon, Flametongue, must reclaim a friend the knight kidnapped on the way out.

Part of the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks.

name.value: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: Challenge of Druid's Grove

item.description:
You Are Ar-Kane, a Great Wizard (Book One Title)
You Are Renwood, a Powerful Druid (Book Two Title)

Challenge of Druid's Grove is the fourth One-on-One Adventure Gamebook, and involves a race between the representatives of two different factions who are trying to capture each other for ransom while trying to stop a growing evil in the forest of Laith. There are two books in the box set, one for the player of the wizard Ar-Kane and one for the player of the druid Renwood. Players move their characters from location to location, collect items, come into conflict.

name.value: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: The Dragonwand of Krynn

item.description: The tenth game in the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks is set in the world of Dragonlance. One player plays Lord Ariakan, Dragon Highlord. The other player plays Lord Patrick, Knight of Solamnia.
